verses.verse: Now Pashur <S%H6583><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Immer <S%H564><s%> the priest, <S%H3548><s%> who <S%H1931><s%> was also chief <S%H5057><s%> governor <S%H6496><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> that <S%H853><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> prophesied <S%H5012><s%> <S%H853><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things. <S%H1697><s%>

Then Pashur <S%H6583><s%> smote <S%H5221><s%> <S%H853><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet, <S%H5030><s%> and put <S%H5414><s%> him in <S%H5921><s%> the stocks <S%H4115><s%> that <S%H834><s%> were in the high <S%H5945><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%> of Benjamin, <S%H1144><s%> which <S%H834><s%> was by the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

And it came to pass <S%H1961><s%> on the morrow, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4283><s%> that Pashur <S%H6583><s%> brought forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H853><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> out of <S%H4480><s%> the stocks. <S%H4115><s%> Then said <S%H559><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> him, The LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath not <S%H3808><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%> Pashur, <S%H6583><s%> but <S%H3588><s%> <S%H518><s%> Magor-missabib. <S%H4036><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> thus <S%H3541><s%> saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I will make <S%H5414><s%> thee a terror <S%H4032><s%> to thyself, and to all <S%H3605><s%> thy friends: <S%H157><s%> and they shall fall <S%H5307><s%> by the sword <S%H2719><s%> of their enemies, <S%H341><s%> and thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> it: and I will give <S%H5414><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> and he shall carry them captive <S%H1540><s%> into Babylon, <S%H894><s%> and shall slay <S%H5221><s%> them with the sword. <S%H2719><s%>

Moreover I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the strength <S%H2633><s%> of this <S%H2063><s%> city, <S%H5892><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the labors <S%H3018><s%> thereof, and all <S%H3605><s%> the precious things <S%H3366><s%> thereof, and all <S%H3605><s%> the treasures <S%H214><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> will I give <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their enemies, <S%H341><s%> which shall spoil <S%H962><s%> them, and take <S%H3947><s%> them, and carry <S%H935><s%> them to Babylon. <S%H894><s%>

And thou, <S%H859><s%> Pashur, <S%H6583><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> that dwell <S%H3427><s%> in thine house <S%H1004><s%> shall go <S%H1980><s%> into captivity: <S%H7628><s%> and thou shalt come <S%H935><s%> to Babylon, <S%H894><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> thou shalt die, <S%H4191><s%> and shalt be buried <S%H6912><s%> there, <S%H8033><s%> thou, <S%H859><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> thy friends, <S%H157><s%> to whom <S%H834><s%> thou hast prophesied <S%H5012><s%> lies. <S%H8267><s%>

O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> thou hast deceived <S%H6601><s%> me, and I was deceived: <S%H6601><s%> thou art stronger <S%H2388><s%> than I, and hast prevailed: <S%H3201><s%> I am <S%H1961><s%> in derision <S%H7814><s%> daily, <S%H3605><s%> <S%H3117><s%> every one <S%H3605><s%> mocketh <S%H3932><s%> me.

For <S%H3588><s%> since <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1767><s%> I spoke, <S%H1696><s%> I cried out, <S%H2199><s%> I cried <S%H7121><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> and spoil; <S%H7701><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> was made <S%H1961><s%> a reproach <S%H2781><s%> unto me, and a derision, <S%H7047><s%> daily. <S%H3605><s%> <S%H3117><s%>

Then I said, <S%H559><s%> I will not <S%H3808><s%> make mention <S%H2142><s%> of him, nor <S%H3808><s%> speak <S%H1696><s%> any more <S%H5750><s%> in his name. <S%H8034><s%> But his word was <S%H1961><s%> in mine heart <S%H3820><s%> as a burning <S%H1197><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> shut up <S%H6113><s%> in my bones, <S%H6106><s%> and I was weary <S%H3811><s%> with forbearing, <S%H3557><s%> and I could <S%H3201><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> stay.

For <S%H3588><s%> I heard <S%H8085><s%> the defaming <S%H1681><s%> of many, <S%H7227><s%> fear <S%H4032><s%> on every side. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5439><s%> Report, <S%H5046><s%> say they, and we will report <S%H5046><s%> it. All <S%H3605><s%> my familiars <S%H582><s%> <S%H7965><s%> watched <S%H8104><s%> for my halting, <S%H6761><s%> saying, Peradventure <S%H194><s%> he will be enticed, <S%H6601><s%> and we shall prevail <S%H3201><s%> against him, and we shall take <S%H3947><s%> our revenge <S%H5360><s%> on <S%H4480><s%> him.

But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is with <S%H854><s%> me as a mighty <S%H1368><s%> terrible one: <S%H6184><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> my persecutors <S%H7291><s%> shall stumble, <S%H3782><s%> and they shall not <S%H3808><s%> prevail: <S%H3201><s%> they shall be greatly <S%H3966><s%> ashamed; <S%H954><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> they shall not <S%H3808><s%> prosper: <S%H7919><s%> their everlasting <S%H5769><s%> confusion <S%H3639><s%> shall never <S%H3808><s%> be forgotten. <S%H7911><s%>

But, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> that triest <S%H974><s%> the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> and seest <S%H7200><s%> the reins <S%H3629><s%> and the heart, <S%H3820><s%> let me see <S%H7200><s%> thy vengeance <S%H5360><s%> on <S%H4480><s%> them: for <S%H3588><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> thee have I opened <S%H1540><s%> <S%H853><s%> my cause. <S%H7379><s%>

Sing <S%H7891><s%> unto the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> ye <S%H853><s%> the LORD: <S%H3068><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> he hath delivered <S%H5337><s%> <S%H853><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the poor <S%H34><s%> from the hand <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%> of evildoers. <S%H7489><s%>

Cursed <S%H779><s%> be the day <S%H3117><s%> wherein <S%H834><s%> I was born: <S%H3205><s%> let not <S%H408><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> wherein <S%H834><s%> my mother <S%H517><s%> bore <S%H3205><s%> me be <S%H1961><s%> blessed. <S%H1288><s%>

Cursed <S%H779><s%> be the man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> brought tidings <S%H1319><s%> to <S%H853><s%> my father, <S%H1><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> A man <S%H2145><s%> child <S%H1121><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> unto thee; making him very glad. <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8055><s%>

And let that <S%H1931><s%> man <S%H376><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> as the cities <S%H5892><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> overthrew, <S%H2015><s%> and repented <S%H5162><s%> not: <S%H3808><s%> and let him hear <S%H8085><s%> the cry <S%H2201><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and the shouting <S%H8643><s%> at noontide; <S%H6256><s%> <S%H6672><s%>

Because <S%H834><s%> he slew <S%H4191><s%> me not <S%H3808><s%> from the womb; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7358><s%> or that my mother <S%H517><s%> might have been <S%H1961><s%> my grave, <S%H6913><s%> and her womb <S%H7358><s%> to be always <S%H5769><s%> great <S%H2030><s%> with me.

Wherefore <S%H4100><s%> came I forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the womb <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7358><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> labor <S%H5999><s%> and sorrow, <S%H3015><s%> that my days <S%H3117><s%> should be consumed <S%H3615><s%> with shame? <S%H1322><s%>
